abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Road Project includes
            construction and improvement of one road in the Western part
            of the country (Niamey-Tillabery) and improvement of two
            roads in its central part (Magaria-Tinkim-Nigerian border
            and Dan Tyao-Tinkim). The Niamey-Tillabery road (115 km)
            links the national capital with a relatively fertile area
            which provides Niamey with much of its food. Besides the
            traditional staples, millet and sorghum, the area also
            produces increasing quantities of rice and is starting to
            produce sugar. Under the project, this road will be
            realigned and paved for all-weather use. The
            Magaria-Tinkim-Nigerian border (20 km) and Dan Tyao-Tinkim
            (14 km) roads will be used mainly for the export of
            groundnuts from central Niger through Nigeria. Their
            improvement will substantially reduce exporters'
            transportation costs. This implies, however, that Nigeria
            will also improve the road linking the road from the Niger
            border to the city of Kano in northern Nigeria.
